answers.answer: If your insurance covers fertility, everything but the donor, and agency fees will be covered.  If you don't have fertility coverage, it would all be out of pocket.  The insurance company doesn't care where the "egg" came from.

I do have fertility coverage, and they dont cover donor egg, donors take about 7 to 8k, agencies take nearly 5k, so close to 13 to 15k goes from us, insurance does cover the meds and procedures done on us. I may also have to go for donor, i too wish like you that baby comes from my egg, but it may not matter, when we have the baby, i read somewhere "all we take is a single cell from a woman, we build it, we nurture it, we give it blood and we help it grow 9 months", we should forget here about DNA and gene code.

question: Does anyone know if donor eggs are covered by insurance , or what would the cost be? My Re wants me to go with donor eggs, and she's going to check me for diabetes, i don't think i am.. No one in my immediate family ever was, and my grandmother became diabetic at age 85?lol... I know it is very hard to improve egg quality, but it would be nice if our child had a piece of both of us.. Thanks to allBD!
title: DONOR EGG?
